page.title: 18Clevedon Place_names 2
page.content: Our road is called Robin Lane (by Georgina Burns,aged 9).Until 1923 it was a rough unmade lane.It was twice the width it is today with thick high hedges either side and beyond these, fields and a pond.There was only one house ,which was the Lodge(it was on the edge of the Elton family estate.)Behind the hedge there was a large pond where our front lawn (and that of our neighbour's) is situated. Although filled in when development took place ,both lawns have a noticeable slope towards each other. This pond was soon called by local people "Postman's Pond"...because a postman was found dead in it ,with all his letters floating around him!There are still people alive who remember this but no_one really knew what happened. Our house was built in !930.
